stimulusHtml: All of the following statements are factually accurate. Which would best help to explain the Qianlong Emperor’s purpose in commissioning the painting?

features.html:
Ding Guanpeng, Chinese Painter Employed by the Qing Court, Portrait of Emperor Qianlong as the Bodhisattva Manjusri, circa 1765

Freer Gallery of Art, Smithsonian Institution, Washington, D.C.: Purchase — Charles Lang Freer

 

The emperor is dressed as a Tibetan Buddhist teacher (lama). The Bodhisattva Manjusri is a major figure worshiped in the Tibetan Buddhist religious tradition.

choicesHtml: The Qing Empire had subjugated Korea, which had a population that included many Buddhists.
The Qing emperors issued edicts and laws promoting Confucian principles in their empire.
The Qing emperors reestablished the Chinese imperial examination system.
The Qing Empire had conquered and politically incorporated the Tibetan Buddhist Dzungar khanate.
